snippet: Aid convoys were attacked during a three-day cease-fire in Homs, highlighting the difficulties plaguing even modest humanitarian efforts in Syria’s civil war.
abstract: Aid convoys are struck by attacks despite three-day cease-fire in Syrian city of Homs, highlighting difficulties plaguing even modest humanitarian efforts in country's civil war; attacks raise stakes for United Nations Security Council as they weigh draft resolution meant to force government and rebel groups to permit aid organizations to operate.

byline.contributor: Somini Sengupta contributed reporting from New York.

lead_paragraph: Aid convoys were attacked during a three-day cease-fire in Homs, highlighting the difficulties plaguing even modest humanitarian efforts in Syria’s civil war.

headline.main: Break in Siege Is Little Relief to Syrian City
headline.print_headline: Break in Siege Is Little Relief to Syrian City
